text: Functional roles of the transcription factor <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the high mobility group protein <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in HLA-DRA gene expression .
The class II major histocompatibility complex gene HLA-DRA is expressed in B cells , activated T lymphocytes , and in antigen-presenting cells .

In addition , HLA-DRA gene expression is inducible in a variety of cell types by <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Here we show that the lymphoid - specific transcription factor <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a critical role in HLA-DRA gene expression in class II - positive B cell lines , and that the high mobility group protein ( HMG ) <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds to multiple sites within the DRA promoter , including the <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site .

Coexpression of HMG <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in cell lines lacking <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> results in high levels of HLA-DRA gene expression , and in vitro DNA - binding studies reveal that HMG <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulates <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding to the HLA-DRA promoter .

text: Thus , <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and HMG <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may synergize to activate HLA-DRA expression in B cells .

By contrast , <extra_id_0> Oct-2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not involved in the <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction of the HLA-DRA gene in HeLa cells , but antisense HMG <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dramatically decreases the level of induction .

We conclude that distinct sets of transcription factors are involved in the two modes of HLA-DRA expression , and that HMG <extra_id_0> I/Y <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may be important for B cell - specific expression , and is essential for <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction .
